item.title: Ticket #3281 (Default category not checked when composing new post) updated
item.dc:creator: alexkingorg
item.description: Better put something in the release notes about this, as an existing user this seems like it's "broken".

item.title: Ticket #3281 (Default category not checked when composing new post) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Intentional behavior. Many people regard the default category as something that should only be checked if no other category is selected, not as something that should always be checked. A quick save with no category set will set the default category.

As always, open to arguments why this is a bad idea, but I've gotten a lot of positive feedback from people who were tired of having to uncheck "Uncategorized" every time they published a post.

item.title: Ticket #3281 (Default category not checked when composing new post) created
item.dc:creator: alexkingorg
item.description:
I may be missing something, but I'm not seeing my default category checked when composing a new post in WP 2.1 (trunk).

Tracking back from the 'dropdown_categories' in edit-form-advanced, I see a call to 'write_nested_categories' which passes in the array result of 'get_nested_categories'. So assuming I'm reading this right, the category stuff should be set in 'get_nested_categories'.

In 'get_nested_categories', I see a query to get categories for the post, but no call to 'get_option('default_category')' to set the default category - instead it is set to the $default argument which is never populated in this chain. It *is* populated for links:

wp-admin/edit-link-form.php:46: <ul id="categorychecklist"><?php dropdown_link_categories(get_option('default_link_category')); ?></ul>

This seems like a bug to me, but the chain is deep and I don't know the ins and outs of the admin logic so I'm not sure exactly at what level it needs to be fixed.

item.title: Ticket #3267 (PHP Error in template-functions-links.php) updated
item.dc:creator: westi
item.description:
Keywords changed

Replying to Mike_Koepke:

Well the error occurred again. My domain error log has 5 entries from yesterday. Denis' fix isn't the solution. I'll need to do some troubleshooting to figure out why this is occurring. This ticket should probably get pushed to 2.1 for now.

This looks like you have a plugin which calls that function for particular request types that is calling it before the objects are created.

i.e. the function is called before the {'init'} action fires ​http://trac.wordpress.org/browser/branches/2.0/wp-settings.php#L225.

Do you know what request(s) happen at the same time as the errors in your error_log - some example requests from the access_log may help track this down

item.title: Ticket #3267 (PHP Error in template-functions-links.php) updated
item.dc:creator: Mike_Koepke
item.description:
Milestone changed

Mark,

Well the error occurred again. My domain error log has 5 entries from yesterday. Denis' fix isn't the solution. I'll need to do some troubleshooting to figure out why this is occurring. This ticket should probably get pushed to 2.1 for now.

Mike

item.title: Ticket #1570 (Comments RSS Feed: remove limit on page/post feeds) updated
item.dc:creator: alexkingorg
item.description:
The comments feed is to comments display as the posts feed is to the posts display. That is, the posts and posts feed are both in reverse-chronological order. The comments and comments feed are in chronological order. The limit effectively cuts off comments at that limit. A better way to limit would be to get the number of comments and set an offset too so that the latest comments are always included.

Perhaps another (updated) patch is required now.

item.title: Ticket #3280 (Addition of an "Auto Line Breaks" toggle.) closed
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
wontfix:

Sorry to snub your overture ;-), but this is -- as you said -- an edge case, so it is a perfect candidate for a plugin using a post meta switch.

Don't know if this still works, but I'd guess it does, or could be easily updated:

​http://dev.wp-plugins.org/wiki/TextControl

What would also be a nice addition to the plugin, now that we have user meta, is per-user settings... so if you have a multiuser blog, a longtime Textile or Markdown user can use their syntax of choice, while not messing up other people's defaults.

item.title: Ticket #3280 (Addition of an "Auto Line Breaks" toggle.) updated
item.dc:creator: bryanveloso
item.description:
Owner changed

Assigned to Mark, because I adore him so. :]

item.title: Ticket #3280 (Addition of an "Auto Line Breaks" toggle.) created
item.dc:creator: bryanveloso
item.description:
User reports wanting to put HTML in a post, only to see that line breaks are placed after tags, naturally, because each of those lines do have line breaks after them. Proposal to add a check box that will allow users to disable the auto-paragraph and line break option on a per case basis.

I realize this is an edge case, but it could prove useful. I thought this already existed, but maybe it's one of my many hallucinations. :]

item.title: Ticket #3279 (Theme doesn't load properly when theme directory name contains a '+' sign) created
item.dc:creator: ming
item.description:
A theme directory that contains the '+' symbol causes WP to choke on the directory name. Once activated WP can no longer access the theme directory so the site is blank (view source is completely empty).

The 'current theme' section contains no information: ie "All of this theme’s files are located in ."

I haven't checked other symbols besides the plus sign

Using WAMP development server on WinXP WP version 2.1-alpha3 nightly build (oct 22?)

item.title: Ticket #3277 (WYSIWYG editor not work with squid/2.5.STABLE9 proxy) created
item.dc:creator: tomash
item.description:
I'm using same laptop at work and at home. I login to the same WordPress instance. At home I have direct DSL internet connection, at work my network configuration forces me to use proxy server with squid (squid/2.5.STABLE9) installed.

At home wysiwyg editor works great. Then at work, without any other changes, it fails with errors on javascript console: 

Błąd: sack is not defined
Plik źródłowy: http://poleska.dreamhosters.com/wp-admin/cat-js.php
Wiersz: 1
Błąd: edToolbar is not defined
Plik źródłowy: http://poleska.dreamhosters.com/wp-admin/post.php
Wiersz: 164
Błąd: tinyMCE is not defined
Plik źródłowy: http://poleska.dreamhosters.com/wp-admin/post.php
Wiersz: 174
Błąd: dbxManager is not defined
Plik źródłowy: http://poleska.dreamhosters.com/wp-admin/post.php
Wiersz: 18
Błąd: Nieznana własność "filter".  Deklaracja opuszczona.
Plik źródłowy: http://poleska.dreamhosters.com/wp-admin/inline-uploading.php?post=-1161691353&action=upload
Wiersz: 291

All plugins are disabled in wp vanilla installation. Bug affects both IE and Firefox, before and after cleaning cache, removing cookies, forcing refresh by f5/ctrl-f5 and so on.

item.title: Ticket #3275 (Post and edit Pages to future) updated
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description: I meant to write passionate not patient.

item.title: Ticket #3275 (Post and edit Pages to future) closed
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description:
invalid:

Closing as INVALID.

Hi Akatemik, thank you for contributing to WordPress development.

It is best to write in terms of the problem before suggestion solutions.

It is best not to include two issues in a single ticket: (1) writing pages for the future (2) time based versioning (not sure if that describes what you are looking for) The problems you are trying to solve do not seem to apply to most people using WordPress. If this is something you are patient about I suggest writing a plugin for this.
